result.execSummary:
The defendant Bianca Dowl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No violent contact with victim.
No physical discipline.

A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Programming can be completed through BMCW.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court grants expungement upon successfull completion of ALL terms of probation within 12 months.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bianca Dowl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bianca Dowl in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further is not needed.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court reviewed and returned photographs. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 7 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-No physical discipline.
-Pay all Mandatorty court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Programming can be completed through BMCW.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
*Court grants expungement upon successful completion of ALL terms of probation with in 12 MONTHS.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 PER AMENDED INFORMATION
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Bianca Dowl in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Plea Hearing. Received & Filed, Amended Information which reads: 
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2:Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a class B Misdemeanor.  
Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.


  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bianca Dowl in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood, who appeared via telephone.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Defense counsel unable to appear in court due to medical issue. Parties have reached a resolution, requests plea hearing date. Case adjourned for a plea hearing to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bianca Dowl in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, but parties have reached a resolution. Parties stipulate to placing witnesses on call, defense to enter in to plea day of trial. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 07/16/2014.

Defendant Bianca Dowl in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Matthew J Torbenson for Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Stipulation And Order Regarding Use Of Videotaped Statements.

Defendant Bianca Dowl in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.D.P. (DOB:  04/06/2009) or any of her other children, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare or Children's Court.

Defendant Bianca Dowl in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Bianca Dowl in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
